climbs.name: Rumple Killskin
climbs.fa: Lauren Bergeron, Jonathan Garlough & Joshua Corbett

content.description: Located on the left edge of the Magnum Block. Climb the steep face on big holds past two bolts to a horizontal with gear. Finish up into the left facing corner on big holds to a ring anchor. 30
content.protection: 2 bolts, mid-#2 will work, ring anchor

climbs.name: The Swell
climbs.fa: Loran Smith and Jim Dickson   Nov. 20, 2012

content.description: Make some chimney/stemming moves up the back of the alcove until it is possible to step onto the left side wall.  Place pro, then move up the awesome but short corner to a crux pull out the lip and onto easier slabs above.
content.protection: Good but finicky.  Small cams or aliens, brass nuts, and normal rack w/2" cam.
content.location: On the right side of the Magnum Block is an alcove. The swell starts on the left wall of the alcove, under the obvious roof with a curving inside corner above it.

climbs.name: Pipe line
climbs.fa: James Dickson & loran smith & Joshua Corbett

content.description: Start five feet right of the beech tree at an obvious chimney.  Stem your way up to a short offwith placing gear, then make a cool move Up an over the offwith. Finish up the slab to the trees.
content.location: Start five feet right of a beech tree at an obvious chimney.

content.description: Climb up the center of the Magnum Block making the low crux moves past the first bolt to gain the little white flake at the second bolt. Move up to a horizontal with gear and make a throw to a small horn on the arête and clip the ring anchor. 30

climbs.name: The Beech
climbs.fa: Loran Smith and Jim Dickson   Nov 20, 2012

content.description: Starting just right of the large beech tree, make crux moves up the overhanging swell.  Follow the arete up the right side of the Magnum Block until an obvious break right to a belay tree.
content.protection: Small rack of stoppers and small-mid sized cams.  It is possible to sling branches on the beech tree to protect the start.
content.location: On the right side of the Magnum Block is an alcove.  The Beech starts on the outside, left edge of the alcove and slab above, just right of a large beech tree.

content.description: Above the Pinnacle Block is a short wall with several fun lines. This small wall offers slab routes starting at 5.3 and also has steeper lines in the 5.10 range.
